That&#8217;s because this is the off-season Vancouver must attempt to successfully replace Rollie Melanson. Now moving on for a host of reasons, Melanson&#8217;s arrival in Vancouver six years ago marked a turning point for the franchise. It&#8217;s [&#8230;]</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:46:52 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915666.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Botchford: Replacing Rollie the goalie coach no easy task for Canucks" href="http://vancouversun.com/sports/hockey/nhl/vancouver-canucks/botchford-replacing-rollie-the-goalie-coach-no-easy-task-for-canucks" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11915582</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/lions+roar+with+home+look+more+meow+roadies/11915582/story.html</link><title>Lions roar with new home look, more of a meow for the roadies</title><description>Achieving a distinctive style with visual impact is what Lucy Croysdill, the founder and chief designer of PivotStar, a North Vancouver-based manufacturer of roller derby uniforms, seeks in her apparel. A connoisseur of what works and what doesn&#8217;t in the sports design industry &#8212; women&#8217;s flat track roller derby has been called &#8220;the fastest growing [&#8230;]</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:46:37 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11914679.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Lions roar with new home look, more of a meow for the roadies" href="http://vancouversun.com/sports/football/cfl/bc-lions/lions-roar-with-new-home-look-more-of-a-meow-for-the-roadies" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11915445</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/sports/soccer/whitecaps+kudo+broken+after+brutal+will+undergo+surgery/11915445/story.html</link><title>Weber: Whitecaps' Kudo has a broken jaw after brutal hit, will undergo surgery</title><description>Whitecaps striker Masato Kudo has a broken jaw and will undergo surgery, the club announced on Thursday. Kudo left Wednesday&#8217;s 2-1 win over the Chicago Fire at B.C. Place after a heavy collision with Fire goalkeeper&#160;Matt Lampson in the 11th minute. Kudo suffered a concussion and cuts to his lip and tongue. The incident was [&#8230;]</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:46:12 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915152.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Weber: Whitecaps' Kudo has a broken jaw after brutal hit, will undergo surgery" href="http://vancouversun.com/sports/soccer/mls/vancouver-whitecaps/vancouver-whitecaps-fc-masato-kudo-has-a-broken-jaw-will-undergo-surgery" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11915788</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/sports/hockey/sharks+take+huge+bite+predators+game+west+conference/11915788/story.html</link><title>Sharks take a huge bite out of Predators in Game 7 of West Conference semifinal</title><description>San Jose turned the Shark Tank water red with Predators' blood in a 60-minute slaughter where the 5-0 final score actually flattered the losers.

The Predators, who did such a great job and when their backs were against the wall in the playoffs, were thoroughly overwhelmed when they came face to face with San Jose's desperation.</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 04:36:37 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915789.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link line, NBA series comes down to Raptors’ Lowry vs. Heat’s Wade</title><description>These are your Toronto Raptors, battered, bruised, slightly broken, yet one game ahead, one game to win to move to a place they have never known before. The Eastern Conference Finals of the NBA. A land that once seemed impossible or improbable or both, and here's what's left of the Raptors this close to making history of their own.</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:43:31 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915733.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Bottom line, NBA series comes down to Raptors’ Lowry vs. Heat’s Wade" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/sports/nba/bottom-line-nba-series-comes-down-to-raptors-lowry-vs-heats-wade" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11915461</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/sports/hoss+talk+gift+life+from+mother+kept+horseman+bill+konyk+going/11915461/story.html</link><title>Hoss Talk: Gift of life from mother-in-law kept horseman Bill Konyk, Jr. going</title><description>By Tom Wolski If there is one thing for certain, there&#8217;ll be no mother-in-law jokes heard in horse racing&#8217;s Konyk household.</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:46:19 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915462.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Hoss Talk: Gift of life from mother-in-law kept horseman Bill Konyk, Jr. going" href="http://vancouversun.com/sports/hoss-talk" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11915746</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/sports/golf/record+books+golf+ranked+player+fires+players+championship/11915746/story.html</link><title>A Day for the record books as golf’s No. 1 ranked player fires 63 at The Players Championship</title><description>Day was as flawless as the morning conditions &#8212; summer heat, surprising calm. Kimura: Fight fans should count their blessings, not rank them</title><description>There is a really strange phenomenon that takes place inside the MMA bubble when UFC pay-per-view fight cards get announced and begin lining up one after the other after the other. Fans and pundits start comparing the quality and depth of the events, bent on ranking the cards and arguing about which event is best and why.</description><source>Sports</source><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:50:36 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915074.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Keyboard Kimura: Fight fans should count their blessings, not rank them" href="http://vancouversun.com/sports/mma/keyboard-kimura-fight-fans-should-count-their-blessings-not-rank-them" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11912890</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/sports/bc+lions/getting+killed+media+fans+over+perception+poor/11912890/story.html</link><title>CFL 'getting killed in the media, by fans' over perception of poor officiating</title><description>The National Football League is constantly under attack from all corners over its officiating, the blown calls and the sheer number of flags flying. So was the delayed celebration. Spurs are hoping to hold onto second place, with bitter rivals Arsenal only two points behind them. The Gunners play Aston Villa&#160;at home, which is pretty close to three points in the bag.
